result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifford O Olson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clifford O Olson in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-41, 14TR-803 and 14CT-81.

11:43 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.
Matters are set for a plea and sentencing.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

There is an agreement.
14CT-81 Defendant is pleading to Count 1 OWI 3rd. Count 2 is being dismised.
15CM-41 Dismissed and Read In
14tR-803 Dismissed and Read In

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 14CT-81 Count 1: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Johnson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CT-81 Count 1: OWI 3rd offense
14CT-81 Count 2: Dismissed
15CM-41: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-803: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. Atty Johnson submits an IID exemption application. Atty Johnson addresses half price IID request.

BY THE COURT:
14CT-81:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 90 Days
First 45 days of jail term may be served on electronic monitoring, remainder of the 90 days, less good time, are to be served in custody
Jail sentence to commence TODAY
Huber granted
Pay a fine and costs totaling $3,214
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or work out a payment plan with the clerk
Drivers License Revoked for 33 Months
IID for 33 Months
DOT Assessment and comply with recommendations of safety plan
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:37 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court notes Authorization has been filed. 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered by Atty Johnson.
Court accepts the plea. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued. 

Atty Johnson makes statements to the Court.  Jury trial is scheduled next week on another matter.  Both may be resolved.  Jury Trial be removed from next week and these matters both be set together.  

BY THE COURT:  Jury trial in 14TR803 and 14CT81 are cancelled and set for the same date as this file.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
for Leave to File Additional Motions
Stipulation and Order to Amend Bond Conditions /s/ JVF 02/02/15

Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

2/5/15 Amended condition:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements re: bond. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  2/2/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
